screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google Photos app with a "No photos" message. Below that, there is a "Back up & sync" section, indicating the app is set to upload high-quality photos over Wi-Fi only. There's an option to change settings and a confirmation button to finalize the settings.
action_think: The user is looking to see their creations saved in Google Photos. Since the current screen shows that Google Photos is configured to sync, the next step is to proceed with the confirmation to apply the settings and then open the app to view their creations.
action_result: The last action of clicking on the "Confirm" button has completed the process for uploading your photos to Google Photos. Now, the photo upload is set to high quality and will only upload over Wi-Fi, which is a necessary step to save space on your device and prevent data usage from increasing. You should now be able to view your photos in the Google Photos app.
